Diagnosis
	1. WHO grade III anaplastic oligodendroglioma of right frontal lobe
	Date of diagnosis
	January 2024

	Treatment aim
	Curative

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	15 Jan 2024 Right frontal craniotomy and gross total resection

	Radiotherapy
	1 Mar 2024 - 12 Apr 2024
	Radical intensity modulated radiotherapy (IMRT) 59.4Gy in 33 fractions

	Chemotherapy
	PCV chemotherapy commenced 15 May 2024

	Clinical studies
	None

	Current disease status
	No evidence of disease on latest imaging

	Current issues
	Mild chemotherapy-related fatigue and thrombocytopenia

	Summary of consultation
	Reviewed today prior to cycle 3 of PCV chemotherapy. [redacted name] has managed the first two cycles reasonably well with expected side effects. Main issues have been grade 2 fatigue and grade 1 nausea, both managed with supportive medications. Latest blood tests show platelet count of 98 x 10^9/L (reduced from 125 last cycle), neutrophils stable at 2.1, and hemoglobin 11.2 g/dL.

Neurologically stable with no new deficits. Seizures remain well-controlled on levetiracetam 750mg BD. Post-radiation MRI from 2 May 2024 showed expected post-treatment changes with no evidence of disease progression.

Performance status remains 1, though notes increased fatigue in the week following chemotherapy requiring additional rest periods. Has maintained good oral intake and stable weight at 72kg.

	Further investigations
	Routine blood tests prior to next cycle
MRI brain scheduled for 15 July 2024

	Medication prescribed
	Ondansetron 8mg BD for 3 days with each cycle
Dexamethasone 4mg BD for 3 days with each cycle

	Follow up
	Next oncology follow up in 3 weeks for cycle 4 PCV
Neurosurgical follow up arranged for August 2024

	Required GP actions
	Weekly FBC monitoring between cycles
Please monitor anticonvulsant levels as per protocol
